greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least positive integer k such that n*(n + k) is a perfect square.
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
mathematica: Do[k = 1; While[ !IntegerQ[ Sqrt[ k (k + n)]], k++ ]; Print[k], {n, 0, 75} ]
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(k=1); while(!issquare(n*(n+k)), k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 05 2015
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 05 2002
